rev.desc.rev.desc: Upgrade Utility: Support to upgrade to SM9.62
Do NOT dump upgrade.ver for lightweight upgrade oob build
AGMRQ10H43093
Smart Upgrade Utility I: Make smart upgrade utility for both classic and lightweight upgrade - part 1
ask user filter-out unchanged objects after user select phases during creating custom upgrade packge
Update codes to build upgrade package to support 9.3x PD upgrade to 9.40
When build custom upgrade for PD, invoke apm.upgrade.builder.pd and apm.upgrade.export.pd
Modified the default path from "D:" to "C:" if the user has not input the export path.
Modfied panel: check.path
Update codes to build upgrade package to support 9.3x PD upgrade to 9.40
Roll back to call enable.pd
Move the phase information log from validate panel to check.path panel, because in this panel, the exporting path should be check whether it end with "\" or "/"
Update codes to build upgrade package to support 9.3x PD upgrade to 9.40
call RAD enable.pd
Update codes to build upgrade package to support 9.3x PD upgrade to 9.40
When build pd, set $G.pd.build=true and only export without build upgradeobjects.
Update codes to build upgrade package to support 9.3x PD upgrade to 9.40
Copy the transfer log to detail log during creating custom package.
Add the $G.LogPath global parameter in panel validate.
The parameter $G.logPath will be referred in the RAD apm.upgrade.write.file.
Optimized upgrade log and added phase information during creating custom package.
Added panel : check.path.done, post.build.export, prep.run.export, post.run.export.
Modified panel : check.path.1, validate, prep.build.export, prep.build.transfer, prep.complete.
When create custom upgrade, check NEW, PRE and OLD records and remind user to purge
Missing Survey OOB data in the upgraded system
Removed following unreferenced variables in panel=start:$L.void1, $L.overwrite, $$L.transfer, $L.connect
Two different records come to be same record because of encoding during upgrading with custom upgrade package
automatically purge prefix data when create customer package
The languages shown on "Apply an Upgrade" should base on both the languages the system supports and the upgrade package supports. Also removed a lot of faint code.
add Polish in upgrade language select list
Remove option to log internally
add set.client.unload(false), the upgrade package output to server side.
add backslash handler before path check
remove default path for upgrade build path
start: add Arabic language support
start: add Arabic language support
recompile only
turn off the default internal log.
modify to make sure that the wizard will not continue if the data folder creation is failed.
add Creation of 'data' Subfolder functionality. the default parent folder is "../CustomUpgrade/".
remove upgrade type
Modification made for CenterPoint Request 37109 Task 32931.
Spanish was added as a supported language in SC6.1. Modification made to the start panel to account for this.
Added processing to increment the build number in the upgverbld file by +1 during the creation of the upgrade. See SCR32590 for panels modified/created.
Modification for CenterPoint Request 32254 Task 29705.
Modification made to process the new prompt that asks the customer which languages should be included in the Upgrade Build.
To effect this change, the following panels were modified:
start
. added code to establish linkage to upginfo
. added code to establish linkage to language
. added code to populate the lang.selected array of structures in the upginfo record
(include ONLY the active languages)
check.gui.2
. added a line that exits to gui.2x if the build being done is a multi-language build
gui.2x
. New panel
gui.2x.save
. New panel.
gui.3
. Change the exits for Option 11 (Back) to go to gui.2 if the build being done is an English-only build, but to go to gui.2x if the build being done is a multi-language build.
Case insensitivity problem fixes.
Converted to use scmsg().

Do NOT dump upgrade.ver for lightweight upgrade oob build
AGMRQ10H43093
Smart Upgrade Utility I: Make smart upgrade utility for both classic and lightweight upgrade - part 1
ask user filter-out unchanged objects after user select phases during creating custom upgrade packge

Optimize the upgrade log.
When create custom upgrade, check NEW, PRE and OLD records and remind user to purge

Missing Survey OOB data in the upgraded system
Two different records come to be same record because of encoding during upgrading with custom upgrade package

The languages shown on "Apply an Upgrade" should base on both the languages the system supports and the upgrade package supports. Also removed a lot of faint code.

start: add Arabic language support

turn off the default internal log.
modify to make sure that the wizard will not continue if the data folder creation is failed.

Modification made for CenterPoint Request 37109 Task 32931.
Spanish was added as a supported language in SC6.1. Modification made to the start panel to account for this.
Added processing to increment the build number in the upgverbld file by +1 during the creation of the upgrade. See SCR32590 for panels modified/created.
Modification for CenterPoint Request 32254 Task 29705.
Modification made to process the new prompt that asks the customer which languages should be included in the Upgrade Build.
To effect this change, the following panels were modified:
start
. added code to establish linkage to upginfo
. added code to establish linkage to language
. added code to populate the lang.selected array of structures in the upginfo record
(include ONLY the active languages)
check.gui.2
. added a line that exits to gui.2x if the build being done is a multi-language build
gui.2x
. New panel
gui.2x.save
. New panel.
gui.3
. Change the exits for Option 11 (Back) to go to gui.2 if the build being done is an English-only build, but to go to gui.2x if the build being done is a multi-language build.
Case insensitivity problem fixes.
Converted to use scmsg().
